meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'shop': having more shops nearby.
meanings.sent1: The new neighborhood is shoppier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: This mall is shoppier than the one across town.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I'd live in a shoppier area, but here I am!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like a shoppier street at night.
meanings.sent5: The shoppier atmosphere was bustling with activity.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'shop': engaging in shopping more frequently.
meanings.sent1: She became shoppier after getting her first paycheck.
meanings.sent2: The holiday season always makes people shoppier.
meanings.sent3: His shoppier habits are starting to empty his wallet.
meanings.sent4: The shoppier lifestyle led to a closet full of new clothes.
meanings.sent5: The shoppier behavior was evident in her overflowing shopping bags.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'shop': having a greater tendency to shop.
meanings.sent1: My sister is shoppier than I am; she loves buying new things.
meanings.sent2: As she grew older, her friends became shoppier.
meanings.sent3: The shoppier group always finds the best deals.
meanings.sent4: His shoppier nature made him a regular at the local stores.
meanings.sent5: The shoppier inclination was hard to resist in such a vibrant market.
